column1: 366BCD91-A3E8-4CA0-9180-E294E73AEFEE#appfire#8DE3DDC4-82AF-467A-9011-E52AE675CCAC#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-11 16:01:26.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-11 16:01:26.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#B16D13AB-0F2F-4B7A-830B-C006D97FA5D3#appfire#8DE3DDC4-82AF-467A-9011-E52AE675CCAC#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-11 16:01:26.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-11 16:01:26.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#BEEFFE8C-3323-46A1-9224-20D251FCBF04#appfire#8DE3DDC4-82AF-467A-9011-E52AE675CCAC#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-11 16:01:26.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-05-11 16:01:26.0#appfire#1
